archive.description:
3:03 AM PST We are investigating increased delays for CloudWatch metrics in the US-WEST-2 Region. CloudWatch alarms may transition into "INSUFFICIENT_DATA" state if set on delayed metrics.
3:44 AM PST We can confirm delays in some CloudWatch metrics in the US-WEST-2 Region. We are actively working to resolve the issue.
4:26 AM PST We continue to work to resolve the delays affecting some CloudWatch metrics in the US-WEST-2 Region.
5:17 AM PST We confirm continued delays to some CloudWatch metrics in the US-WEST-2 Region. We continue to work to resolve the issue.
5:55 AM PST We confirm continued delays to some CloudWatch metrics in the US-WEST-2 Region. We continue to work to resolve the issue.
6:12 AM PST Between 02:14 AM PST and 05:51 AM PST in the US-WEST-2 Region, customers experienced increased delays in some metrics. During that time, alarms on delayed metrics may have transitioned into an INSUFFICIENT_DATA state. We have resolved the issue. Delayed metrics are in the process of backfilling in CloudWatch console graphs and for API retrieval. The CloudWatch service is operating normally.

6:47 AM PST We are investigating packet loss between the Direct Connect location at TelecityGroup, London Docklands, and the EU-WEST-1 Region.
7:36 AM PST We can confirm intermittent packet loss between the Direct Connect location at TelecityGroup, London Docklands, and the EU-WEST-1 Region. An external facility providing Direct Connect connectivity to the EU-WEST-1 Region has experienced power loss. We are working with the service provider to mitigate impact and restore power.
8:23 AM PST We have recovered power in the impacted facility and are continuing to investigate and resolve intermittent packet loss and latency between the Direct Connect location at TelecityGroup, London Docklands, and the EU-WEST-1 Region.
8:36 AM PST Between 5:40 AM and 8:20 AM PST we experienced packet loss between the Direct Connect location at TelecityGroup, London Docklands, and the EU-WEST-1 Region. An external facility providing Direct Connect connectivity to the EU-WEST-1 Region experienced power loss. This issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

3:31 PM PST Between 2:26 PM and 2:55 PM PST in the US-EAST-1 Region, customers experienced elevated error rates sending email to the SES SMTP interface. During that time, a portion of requests failed with a temporary authentication failure. Requests to the SES HTTP interface were unaffected, and all requests accepted successfully by SES have been processed normally. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Increased VPC endpoint error rates for S3
archive.description: 3:40 PM PST Between 2:26 PM and 2:55 PM PST we experienced increased error rates accessing VPC endpoints for S3 in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

4:23 PM PST We are investigating increased API error rates for AWS Lambda invocations in the US-EAST-1 Region.
5:08 PM PST Between 1:10 PM and 4:50 PM PST AWS Lambda experienced elevated invocation error rates, including errors in new function creation in the US-EAST-1 Region. We have corrected the cause of the errors and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Elevated Request Timeouts from a Single Edge Location
archive.description: 12:56 PM PST Between 11:59 AM and 12:23 PM PST, some customers experienced request timeouts from a single edge location in Australia. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Increased latency on stack create, delete and update.
archive.description:
4:11 AM PST We are experiencing increased latencies for creating, deleting and updating CloudFormation stacks in the EU-WEST-1 Region.
4:57 AM PST We are working on resolving the root cause for elevated latencies for creating, deleting and updating CloudFormation stacks in the EU-WEST-1 Region.
5:26 AM PST From 2:45 AM to 4:05 AM PST customers experienced increased latencies when creating, deleting and updating CloudFormation stacks in the EU-WEST-1 region. The service has recovered and all queued stack create, update and delete requests are now being processed and the service is operating normally.

4:33 AM PST We can confirm delays in environment creation, termination, and deployment operations in the EU-WEST-1 Region.
5:05 AM PST We are seeing reduced delays in environment creation, termination, and deployment operations in the EU-WEST-1 Region. We will continue to work on resolving the delays fully.
5:28 AM PST Between 2:45 AM and 4:05 AM PST, Elastic Beanstalk experienced delays in environment creation, termination, and deployment operations in the EU-WEST-1 Region. The delays have been resolved and the service is now operating normally.

3:19 PM PST We are currently investigating network connectivity issues affecting one of two redundant tunnels for some VPN customers in the EU-WEST-1 Region.
3:26 PM PST Between 2:24 PM and 3:16 PM PST, we experienced connectivity issues affecting one of our redundant VPN gateway devices in the EU-WEST-1 Region. Each VPN connection is provisioned as a pair of redundant VPN tunnels, to provide customers with the ability to setup separate VPN tunnels to redundant VPN devices. Some customers may have seen one of the two redundant tunnels as unavailable during this time. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

4:29 PM PST We are investigating increased Firehose to Redshift delivery delays in the US-EAST-1 Region. We have identified the root cause and are working towards resolution.
5:43 PM PST We continue to perform recovery work in the US-EAST-1 Region. While the delivery of data to Redshift is delayed, data is durably retained in the Firehose delivery stream and delivery to Redshift will resume once recovery is complete.
7:04 PM PST Between 11:40 AM PDT and 7:00 PM PDT we experienced increased Firehose to Redshift delivery delays in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service has resumed normal operation.

[RESOLVED] DNS Resolution Failures

2:28 PM PST Between 12:40 PM and 2:00 PM PST, we experienced elevated error rates for DNS queries from some instances running in a Virtual Private Cloud in the eu-west-1 region. This issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

1:58 PM PST We are investigating elevated error rates resolving DNS names in the eu-west-1 region.

[RESOLVED] Network connectivity

12:40 PM PST Between 12:17 PM and 12:30 PM PST we experienced impaired Internet connectivity affecting some instances in a single Availability Zone in the eu-west-1 region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

12:32 PM PST We are investigating impaired Internet connectivity affecting some instances in a single Availability Zone in the eu-west-1 region.

3:09 AM PST We are currently investigating increased errors when connecting to the Elastic Beanstalk console in the US-EAST-1, AP-SOUTHEAST-1, AP-SOUTHEAST-2, US-WEST-1, and SA-EAST-1 regions.
4:23 AM PST We continue to investigate increased errors when connecting to the Elastic Beanstalk console in the US-EAST-1 region. We see signs of recovery in the AP-SOUTHEAST-1, AP-SOUTHEAST-2, US-WEST-1, and SA-EAST-1 regions. We will continue to work toward full recovery.
5:26 AM PST From 1:40 AM to 4:25 AM PST customers experienced increased errors when connecting to the Elastic Beanstalk console in the US-EAST-1, AP-SOUTHEAST-1, AP-SOUTHEAST-2, US-WEST-1, and SA-EAST-1 regions. The issue has been resolved and the console is now operating normally.

1:02 PM PST We are investigating elevated latencies and error rates for the DescribeInstances and DescribeTags APIs in the us-east-1 region. Customers may observe elevated error rates or missing tags for instances in the AWS Management Console.
1:44 PM PST We have identified the root cause of elevated latencies and error rates for the DescribeInstances and DescribeTags APIs and are currently working to resolve. Customers may observe elevated error rates or missing tags for instances in the AWS Management Console.
3:03 PM PST Between 12:30 PM and 2:44 PM PST, we experienced elevated latencies and error rates for the DescribeInstances and DescribeTags APIs. During this period, customers may have observed elevated error rates and missing tags for instances in the AWS Management Console. During this event, instances continued running normally. Tags requested during this period are now visible. This issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

1:27 PM PST We are investigating increased deployment error rates in the us-east-1 Region while creating new deployments.
1:51 PM PST We have identified the root cause of increased deployment error rates in the us-east-1 region and are currently working to resolve.
3:00 PM PST Between 12:35 PM PST and 2:54 PM PST we experienced an increased error rate while executing deployments, affecting some customers in the us-east-1 region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

10:21 AM PST Between 9:29 AM and 9:57 AM PST we experienced connectivity issues for Direct Connect connections to the US-WEST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.
10:23 AM PST Between 9:29 AM and 9:57 AM PST we experienced connectivity issues for VPN connections to the US-WEST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Degraded volume performance for some EBS volumes
archive.description:
11:54 AM PST We are currently investigating degraded performance for a small number of EBS volumes in a single AZ in the US-GOV-WEST-1 Region.
12:54 PM PST We continue to investigate degraded performance for a small number of EBS volumes in a single AZ in the US-GOV-WEST-1 Region. Customers may have difficulty accessing an instance attached to one of these degraded volumes.
2:27 PM PST We continue to investigate degraded performance for a small number of EBS volumes in a single AZ in the US-GOV-WEST-1 Region. Customers may have difficulty accessing an instance attached to one of these degraded volumes. Customers with degraded boot volumes can recover by terminating and re-launching the EC2 instance attached to the volume.
3:52 PM PST Between 10:40 AM and 3:13 PM PST, a small number of EBS volumes in a single Availability Zone in the US-GOV-WEST-1 Region experienced degraded performance. Some of the affected volumes will require action from customers and we will be reaching out to those customers with next steps. The issue has been resolved and the service is now operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Increased API Error Rates and Latencies
archive.description:
1:55 PM PST We are investigating increased API error rates and event processing latencies in the US-EAST-1 Region.
2:35 PM PST Between 1:05 PM and 2:00 PM PST we experienced increased API error rates and event processing latencies in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally. Previously delayed events are being processed now.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Elevated API faults and latencies in AP-SOUTHEAST-1
archive.description:
7:35 PM PST We are investigating increased faults and latencies for CloudWatch APIs and metrics in the AP-SOUTHEAST-1 Region. CloudWatch alarms may transition into "INSUFFICIENT_DATA" state if set on delayed metrics.
8:09 PM PST Between 5:05 PM PST and 7:30 PM PST, some customers experienced elevated faults when calling CloudWatch APIs in the AP-SOUTHEAST-1 Region. Some metrics were delayed, and CloudWatch alarms on delayed metrics transitioned into INSUFFICIENT_DATA state. We have resolved the issue. Delayed metrics are in the process of backfilling in CloudWatch console graphs and for API retrieval. The service is operating normally.

7:42 PM PST We are investigating increased error rates for Send and Receive API calls in the AP-SOUTHEAST-1 Region
8:25 PM PST Between 7:17 PM and 8:06 PM PST we experienced increased error rates and elevated latencies for SQS in the AP-SOUTHEAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

11:46 PM PST Between 11:14 PM and 11:22 PM PST, we experienced elevated packet loss to a single Availability Zone in the US-WEST-2 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

11:50 PM PST Between 11:14 PM and 11:22 PM PST, we experienced elevated packet loss to a single Availability Zone in the US-GOV-WEST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

3:13 PM PST We are investigating connectivity issues for some instances in the US-EAST-1 Region.
3:33 PM PST We can confirm connectivity issues when using public IP addresses for some instances within the EC2-Classic network in the US-EAST-1 Region. Connectivity between instances when using private IP addresses is not affected. We continue to work on resolution.
4:00 PM PST We continue to work on resolving the connectivity issues when using public IP addresses for some instances within the EC2-Classic network in the US-EAST-1 Region. For instances with an associated Elastic IP address (EIP), we have confirmed that re-associating the EIP address will restore connectivity. For instances using EC2 provided public IP addresses, associating a new EIP address will restore connectivity.
6:19 PM PST  We continue to work on resolving public IP address connectivity for some EC2-Classic instances in the US-EAST-1 Region. We have started to see recovery for some of the affected instances and continue to work towards full recovery.
7:11 PM PST Between 2:26 PM and 7:10 PM PST we experienced connectivity issues when using public IP addresses for some instances within the EC2 Classic network in the US-EAST-1 Region. Connectivity between instances using the private IP address was not affected. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Increased Launch Error Rates / [RESOLVED] Increased API Error Rates
archive.description:
[RESOLVED] Increased Launch Error Rates

1:37 PM PST We are investigating increased error rates for new instance launches in a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 region. Running instances are not affected.
1:54 PM PST Between 12:46 PM and 1:46 PM PST we experienced increased error rates for EC2 instance launches in a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 Region. Existing instances were unaffected. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

[RESOLVED] Increased API Error Rates

5:30 AM PST We are investigating increased error rates for EBS APIs and elevated errors for new EBS-backed instance launches in the US-EAST-1 Region.
6:02 AM PST We can confirm an improvement in the increased error rates for EBS APIs and elevated errors for new EBS backed instance launches in the US-EAST-1 Region. We continue to work towards full recovery.
6:21 AM PST Between 4:34 AM and 5:57 AM PST we experienced increased error rates for EBS APIs and elevated errors for new EBS backed instance launches in the US-EAST-1 Region. Existing instances were unaffected. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

2:49 AM PST We are investigating increased API error rates and latencies in the SA-EAST-1 Region.
3:01 AM PST We can confirm connectivity issues affecting instances in a single Availability Zone and increased API error rates for the EC2 APIs in the SA-EAST-1 Region.
3:43 AM PST We continue to investigate connectivity issues affecting instances in a single Availability Zone in the SA-EAST-1 Region. Connectivity between instances in the affected Availability Zone and instances in other Availability Zones, as well as connectivity from instances in the affected Availability Zone to other AWS services such as S3 are affected by this event. CloudWatch instance metrics from instances in the affected Availability Zone are also delayed. We continue to work towards resolution.
4:27 AM PST We have restored connectivity between instances in the affected Availability Zone and other AWS services. Delays in CloudWatch instance metrics from the affected Availability Zone have been resolved. We continue to work on restoring connectivity between instances in the affected Availability Zone and instances in other Availability Zones as well as resolving the increased API error rates for the EC2 APIs.
4:47 AM PST We are seeing recovery for connectivity issues affecting instances in a single Availability Zone in the SA-EAST-1 Region. The increased error rates for the EC2 APIs have been resolved. We continue to monitor recovery.
5:01 AM PST Between 2:15 AM and 4:33 AM PST we experienced connectivity issues for instances in a single Availability Zone and increased error rates for the EC2 APIs in the SA-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

3:08 AM PST We can confirm network connectivity issues affecting instances in a single Availability Zone in the SA-EAST-1 Region.
4:08 AM PST We are working to resolve the network connectivity issues affecting some Single-AZ instances in a single Availability Zone in the SA-EAST-1 Region. Multi-AZ instances continue to function normally.
5:01 AM PST Between 2:15 and 4:33 AM PST, we experienced network connectivity issues affecting some instances in a single Availability Zone in the SA-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

3:17 AM PST We are investigating network connectivity issues for load balancers in a single Availability Zone in the SA-EAST-1 Region.
4:14 AM PST We continue to investigate connectivity issues for load balancers in a single Availability Zone in the SA-EAST-1 Region. We are also experiencing increased latencies for load balancer provisioning and registration of back-end instances. We continue to work towards resolution.
5:02 AM PST Between 2:15 AM and 4:33 AM PST we experienced connectivity issues for load balancers in a single Availability Zone and increased error rates for the ELB APIs in the SA-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

4:01 AM PST We can confirm network connectivity issues affecting cache clusters in a single Availability Zone in the SA-EAST-1 Region.
5:03 AM PST Between 2:15 AM and 4:33 AM PST we experienced connectivity issues affecting some nodes in a single Availability Zone in the SA-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

4:06 AM PST We can confirm connectivity issues in one Availability Zone in the SA-EAST-1 region. Provisioning, termination, and deployments to AWS Elastic Beanstalk environments in that Zone are being delayed.
5:01 AM PST Between 2:15 AM and 4:33 AM PST we experienced delays in provisioning, termination, and deployments to Elastic Beanstalk environments in one Availability Zone of the SA-EAST-1 Region. The errors have recovered and the service is now operating normally.

4:25 AM PST We are investigating increased launch times for EC2 instances managed by Auto Scaling in the SA-EAST-1 Region.
5:01 AM PST Between 2:15 AM and 4:33 AM PST we experienced increased launch times for EC2 instances. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Elevated API faults and latencies in SA-EAST-1
archive.description:

Some metrics were delayed, and CloudWatch alarms on delayed metrics transitioned into INSUFFICIENT_DATA state. Delayed metrics are in the process of backfilling in CloudWatch console graphs and for API retrieval. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Higher than expected latency in ap-northeast-1
archive.description:
8:03 PM PST Storage Gateway is experiencing higher than normal latency in ap-northeast-1 affecting some Gateway connections. We are working on the issue and will update you shortly.
8:57 PM PST We continue to experience increased latency affecting some gateway connections in the AP-NORTHEAST-1 region and are actively working to resolve the issue.
9:54 PM PST We are working to return the increased latencies to normal which affected some gateway connections in the AP-NORTHEAST-1 Region. We are in the process of resolving the issue and the latencies are now recovering.
10:47 PM PST Between 06:20 PM and 09:15 PM PST, we experienced elevated latencies in the AP-NORTHEAST-1 Region. This issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

4:38 AM PST We are currently investigating elevated latency for some Storage Gateway connections in the AP-NORTHEAST-1 Region.
5:07 AM PST We are seeing an improvement in the increased latency affecting some Storage Gateway connections in the AP-NORTHEAST-1 Region. We continue to work towards full recovery.
6:13 AM PST We continue to see improved latency for Storage Gateway connections in the AP-NORTHEAST-1 Region and are focused on reaching full recovery.
10:07 AM PST Between 1:22 AM and 3:30 AM PST we experienced elevated latency for some Storage Gateway connections in the AP-NORTHEAST-1 Region. This issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Increased Provisioning and Instance Registration Times
archive.description:
1:41 PM PST We are investigating increased load balancer provisioning and back-end instance registration times in the US-EAST-1 Region.
2:10 PM PST We continue to work on resolving the increased load balancer provisioning and back-end instance registration times in the US-EAST-1 Region. Load balancing provisioning and registration of back-end instances are completing, but experiencing increased latencies. Connectivity to existing load balancers is not affected.
3:06 PM PST We continue to make progress on resolving the increased load balancer provisioning and back-end instance registration times in the US-EAST-1 Region. Connectivity for existing load balancers is not impacted, but attempting to register back-end instances will result in newly registered instances showing as OutOfService.
3:24 PM PST We are seeing recovery for increased load balancer provisioning and back-end instance registration times in the US-EAST-1 Region. We are currently working through the backlog of newly provisioned load balancers and back-end instance registrations.
3:58 PM PST Between 12:40 PM and 3:40 PM PST we experienced increased provisioning and back-end instance registration times for load balancers in the US-EAST-1 Region. Connectivity for existing load balancers was not impacted, but attempting to register new back-end instances showed as OutOfService. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

5:09 PM PST Between 4:35 PM and 5:00 PM PST we experienced Internet connectivity issues for some instances in a single Availability Zone in the EU-WEST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

5:18 PM PST We’re investigating longer than usual propagation times for changes to CloudFront configurations. End-user requests for content from our edge locations are not affected by this issue and are being served normally.
5:48 PM PST Between 3:06 PM and 5:44 PM PST, some customers experienced increased propagation times for changes to their CloudFront configurations. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

2:44 PM PST We are investigating connectivity issues between some EC2-Classic instances and AWS services, including S3, within the EU-WEST-1 Region.
3:17 PM PST Between 1:53 PM and 3:05 PM PST we experienced connectivity issues between some EC2-Classic instances and S3 within the EU-WEST-1 Region. Launches of new S3-backed instances and CreateSnapshot API requests also experienced increased error rates. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

1:29 PM PST We are investigating an issue with an external provider outside of our network, which may be impacting Internet connectivity between some customer networks and the US-EAST-1 Region. Connectivity to instances and services within the Region is not impacted by the event.
2:03 PM PST Between 11:40 AM and 1:50 PM PST we experienced an Internet connectivity issue with an external provider which affected traffic from some end-user networks and the US-EAST-1 Region. Connectivity to instances and services within the Region was not impacted by the event. The issue has been resolved and connectivity has been restored.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Elevated errors for requests to US-GOV-WEST-1

7:46 PM PST Between 7:05 PM and 7:30 PM PST customers may have seen slightly elevated error rates. The errors have recovered and the service is now operating normally.

7:09 PM PST Between 6:20 PM and 6:43 PM PST we experienced an issue with Internet connectivity to the AP-NORTHEAST-1 Region. Connectivity between instances and services within the region is not impacted. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.service_name: AWS Identity and Access Management (N. Virginia)
archive.description:

3:30 PM PST We are experiencing increased error rates and latencies for the IAM APIs. This is affecting various IAM operations including creating, modifying or querying users, groups, roles or policies directly through IAM APIs or the Console. 3:51 PM PST Between 1:10 PM and 3:45 PM PST the IAM APIs experienced increased error rates. User authentication and access was not impacted. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

7:31 PM PST We are investigating instances of incorrectly reported health status for some Elastic Beanstalk environments in the US-EAST-1 Region.
8:09 PM PST We can confirm that some Elastic Beanstalk environments in the US-EAST-1 Region are reporting incorrect health states. This will not affect running applications. We continue to work towards a resolution.
8:42 PM PST Between 6:15pm and 8:38pm PST, some Elastic Beanstalk environments in the US-EAST-1 Region were incorrectly reported in unhealthy states. At no time were running applications impacted. The issue has been resolved and all environments are reporting health normally.

11:29 PM PST We are investigating increased SMTP E-Mail latencies in the US-EAST-1 Region resulting in a delay of received or sent E-Mails to client applications.
Mar 8, 12:26 AM PST We have identified the root cause of the E-mail delivery latencies and are working towards resolution.

1:13 PM PST We are investigating change propagation delays in our control API. End-user requests for content from our edge locations are not affected by this issue and are being served normally.
2:03 PM PST Between 10:40 AM and 1:45 PM PST, customers experienced increased propagation times for changes to their CloudFront configurations. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

12:25 AM PST We are investigating connectivity issues and degraded EBS volume performance for a small number of instances in a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 Region.
1:26 AM PST We continue to investigate connectivity issues and degraded EBS volume performance for a small number of instances in a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 Region. We have seen recovery for the majority of the affected instances and continue to work towards full recovery.
2:02 AM PST Between March 9 11:29 PM and March 10 1:46 AM PST we experienced periods of connectivity issues and degraded EBS volume performance for a small number of instances in a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

12:51 AM PST We are investigating connectivity issues for a small number of Single-AZ instances in a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 Region. Multi-AZ instances are functioning normally.
1:28 AM PST We continue to investigate connectivity issues for a small number of instances in a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 Region. We have seen recovery for some of the affected instances and we continue to work towards full recovery.
2:21 AM PST Between March 9 11:29 PM and March 10 1:46 AM PST we experienced periods of connectivity issues for a small number of instances in a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

4:33 AM PDT We are investigating increased delays for CloudWatch metrics in the AP-NORTHEAST-1 Region. CloudWatch alarms may transition into "INSUFFICIENT_DATA" state if set on delayed metrics.
5:03 AM PDT Between 03:58 AM and 04:34 AM PDT in the AP-NORTHEAST-1 Region, customers experienced increased delays in some metrics. During that time, alarms on delayed metrics may have transitioned into an INSUFFICIENT_DATA state. We have resolved the issue. Delayed metrics are in the process of backfilling in CloudWatch console graphs and for API retrieval. The CloudWatch service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Elevated API faults and latencies in US-WEST-1
archive.description: 6:21 PM PDT Between 5:24 PM PDT and 5:52 PM PDT, customers experienced an elevated fault rate when calling the GetMetricStatistics API in the US-WEST-1 Region. Some metrics were delayed, and CloudWatch alarms on delayed metrics transitioned into INSUFFICIENT_DATA state. We have resolved the issue. Delayed metrics will be backfilled in CloudWatch console graphs and for API retrieval. The service is operating normally.

3:10 PM PDT We are investigating an issue with an external provider outside of our network. This may be impacting Internet connectivity between some customer networks and the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region. Connectivity to instances and services within the Region is not impacted by the event.
3:45 PM PDT There are confirmed reports of an issue within an external provider’s network. This issue is impacting Internet connectivity between some customer networks and AWS Services in the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region, as well as Internet connectivity to non-AWS locations. We are working with the provider to determine the scope of the problem and time to resolution. Connectivity to instances and services within the Region is not impacted by the event.
4:16 PM PDT We have mitigated the issue by routing around the provider’s network where possible.
4:24 PM PDT Between 2:15 PM PDT and 3:40 PM PDT we experienced an Internet connectivity issue due to an impairment within an external provider’s network which affected traffic from some end-user networks and the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region. Connectivity to instances and services within the Region was not impacted by the event. The issue has been resolved and connectivity has been restored.
At 2:15 PM PDT on Friday March 17, AWS started to receive reports of network connectivity issues towards the Sydney AWS region. We were quickly able to isolate the issue to traffic routing via Telstra, traffic via other providers was working correctly. At 3:40 PM PDT we routed traffic away from the Telstra network and service to customers was restored. After further investigation we confirmed the problem was related to a third party provider and not Telstra’s network as was mistakenly stated on the Dashboard. Recovery occurred when the third party corrected their defective routing, not as a result of AWS routing traffic away from the Telstra network.

3:59 PM PDT We are currently investigating elevated GetSendStatistics API error rates in the US-WEST-2 Region.
4:31 PM PDT We are continuing to investigate elevated GetSendStatistics API error rates in the US-WEST-2 Region.
6:08 PM PDT We are working to identify the root cause of the elevated GetSendStatistics API error rates in the US-WEST-2 Region.
7:15 PM PDT We have identified the cause of elevated error rates for the GetSendStatistics API in the US-WEST-2 Region, and we are working towards resolution of the issue.
8:50 PM PDT We have identified the cause of elevated error rates for the GetSendStatistics API in the US-WEST-2 Region, and we are starting to see improvement. We continue to work towards full recovery.
10:33 PM PDT We continue to experience elevated error rates for the GetSendStatistics API in the US-WEST-2 Region, and continue to work on the identified cause towards full recovery.
Mar 29, 1:45 AM PDT We continue to work on the identified root cause for the GetSendStatistics API in the US-WEST-2 Region. The GetSendStatistics API is used to retrieve statistical information on the usage of the service. All other APIs continue to operate normally. Email sending functionality remains fully operational.
Mar 29, 3:21 AM PDT Between March 28 1:16 PM PDT and March 29 3:15 AM PDT, we experienced elevated error rates for our GetSendStatistics API in the US-WEST-2 Region. The GetSendStatistics API is used to retrieve information on the usage of the service. All other APIs continued to operate normally during the event. archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Increased Error Rates for VPC Management Console
archive.description:
11:54 AM PDT We are investigating increased error rates for the VPC Management Console in the EU-WEST-1 Region.
12:34 PM PDT Between 9:00 AM and 12:15 PM PDT, we experienced increased error rates for the VPC Management Console. VPC APIs were not affected. The issue has been resolved the service is operating normally.

10:47 PM PDT We are investigating increased connectivity issues for EC2 instances in the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region.
11:08 PM PDT We continue to investigate connectivity issues for some instances in a single Availability Zone and increased API error rates for the EC2 APIs in the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region.
11:49 PM PDT We can confirm that instances have experienced a power event within a single Availability Zone in the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region. Error rates for the EC2 APIs have improved and launches of new EC2 instances are succeeding within the other Availability Zones in the Region.
Jun 5, 12:31 AM PDT We have restored power to the affected Availability Zone and are working to restore connectivity to the affected instances.
Jun 5, 1:17 AM PDT We continue to work on restoring connectivity to all instances in the affected Availability Zone. Launches of new EC2 instances are now starting to succeed in the affected Availability Zone but we are experiencing delays in updating instance state data.
Jun 5, 2:47 AM PDT We continue to make progress in restoring connectivity to all instances in the affected Availability Zone. Launches of new EC2 instances are now succeeding in all Availability Zones and instance state data is no longer delayed in the affected Availability Zone.
Jun 5, 4:43 AM PDT Connectivity has been restored for the majority of the instances in the affected Availability Zone and the APIs continue to operate normally. The remaining impacted instances are taking longer to recover. For immediate recovery, we recommend customers that are able to, launch replacement instances.
Jun 5, 11:50 AM PDT On June 4th at 10:25 PM PDT a significant number of EC2 instances and EBS volumes within a single Availability Zone in the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region experienced a loss of power. Beginning at this same time, EC2 API calls in the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region experienced increased error rates and latencies as well as delays in propagation of instance state data in the affected Availability Zone. Instances and volumes in the other Availability Zones in the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region were unaffected. At 11:46 PM PDT, power was restored to the facility and instances and volumes started to recover. At 1:00 AM PDT, 80% of the affected instances and volumes had been recovered by our automated systems. At 2:45 AM PDT the increased error rates and latencies for the EC2 APIs and the delayed propagation of instance state data were fully resolved. A couple of unexpected issues prevented our automated systems from recovering the remaining instances and volumes. The team was able to fix these issues, and by 8:00 AM PDT, all but a small number of instances and volumes were recovered. Since 8:00 AM PDT our teams have been working to recover these remaining instances and volumes. Most of these instances are hosted on hardware which was adversely affected by the loss of power. While we will continue to work to recover any affected instances or volumes, we recommend replacing any remaining affected instances or volumes if possible.

11:01 PM PDT We are investigating increased connectivity issues for load balancers within the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region.
Jun 5, 1:42 AM PDT We continue to work on resolving the connectivity issues affecting some load balancers in a single Availability Zone in the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region. For load balancers in multiple Availability Zones, request traffic will be routed through the unaffected Availability Zones. We are also experiencing increased provisioning times for load balancers in the affected Availability Zone.
Jun 5, 4:58 AM PDT We continue to work on resolving the connectivity issues affecting some load balancers in a single Availability Zone in the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region. We are also experiencing EC2 instances registration delays for some load balancers, which we are working to resolve.
Jun 5, 8:03 AM PDT Connectivity has been restored for the majority of the load balancers in a single Availability Zone in the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region. We are no longer experiencing delays for the registration of EC2 instances. We continue to work to restore connectivity for the remaining load balancers within the affected Availability Zone.
Jun 5, 8:36 AM PDT Between June 4th at 10:25 PM PDT and June 5th at 8:05 AM PDT we experienced increased connectivity issues for load balancers in a single Availability Zone in the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region. During the recovery, we experienced delays in EC2 instance registrations on load balancers in the affected Availability Zone. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

3:27 PM PDT We want to give you a little more data on what’s going on. The issue is caused by an overload of the health-checking mechanism that automatically directs the replacement of instances on failure. This system is flooding the service with configuration requests for replacements. We are working to reduce the replacement workflows. We will give further updates as we see progress.
4:43 PM PDT We have now modified the health check mechanism and deployed it to a small number of affected instances. This reduces the replacement workflow requests. We are working to apply this change to all affected instances. We will post further updates as we deploy this change and see progress.
6:11 PM PDT We have now modified the health check mechanism for the majority of the affected Elasticsearch instances and believe that they are starting to recover. We will post further updates as we see more progress.
7:12 PM PDT We have completed the modification of the health check mechanism for all of the affected Elasticsearch instances. We believe that all of the affected instances should have recovered. We are now running a check to confirm this status and will post back an update as soon this process is complete.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Increased WorkSpaces Launch and Authentication Error Rates
archive.description:

3:16 PM PDT We are seeing improvements in authentication error rates and are making progress towards full resolution.
3:52 PM PDT Between 12:50 PM and 3:08 PM PDT we experienced increased error rates for new WorkSpace launches and authentication requests to existing WorkSpaces in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

3:17 PM PDT We are seeing improvements in authentication error rates and continue to work towards full resolution.
3:37 PM PDT Between 12:49 PM and 3:08 PM PDT we experienced increased Authentication error rates for customers authenticating to the console and the Amazon WorkSuite via Directory Services. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

2:38 PM PDT We are experiencing increased error rates for authentication into the WorkMail console and web client. We have identified the root cause and continue to work towards resolving the issue. Users who are already authenticated are not affected.
3:17 PM PDT We are seeing improvements in authentication error rates and are making progress towards full resolution.
3:51 PM PDT Between 12:49 PM and 3:08 PM PDT we experienced increased error rates for new WorkMail authentication requests in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

8:07 PM PDT We are investigating elevated error rates for the AWS Management Console in the AP-NORTHEAST-1 Region.
9:11 PM PDT Between 7:16 PM and 8:52 PM PDT, some customers experienced increased errors with the AWS Management Console in the AP-NORTHEAST-1 Region. This issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

8:12 PM PDT We are investigating increased API error rates in the AP-NORTHEAST-1 Region.
9:04 PM PDT Between 7:14 PM and 8:39 PM PDT we experienced increased error rates and latencies for API requests in the AP-NORTHEAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

7:44 AM PDT Between 6:53 AM and 7:33 AM PDT we experienced increased API error rates and latencies in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

5:51 AM PDT We have identified the root cause of the issue causing errors resolving the DNS hostname used to access the EC2 APIs and are currently working to resolve.
6:13 AM PDT We are continuing to work to resolve the root cause of the issue. Some EC2 instances are additionally observing failures resolving particular DNS hostnames.

Additionally, some EC2 instances observed failures resolving particular external DNS hostnames. This issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.description: 6:06 AM PST Between 4:25 AM to 5:25 AM PST we experienced increased propagation delays in delivering changes made to IAM. Previously created credentials were not impacted during this period. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

We are starting to see recovery for uploading content to Amazon S3 in the US-EAST-1 Region via S3 Transfer Acceleration. Uploads using the Amazon S3 regional endpoints continue to operate normally.

We are starting to see recovery for uploading content to Amazon S3 in multiple AWS Regions via S3 Transfer Acceleration. Uploads using the Amazon S3 regional endpoints continue to operate normally.
7:54 PM PST Between 3:58 PM and 7:45 PM PST, customers would have experienced errors uploading content to Amazon S3 via S3 Transfer Acceleration. Content delivery through Amazon CloudFront and uploads using the Amazon S3 regional endpoints were operating normally during this time. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.
